@context.title: @Context
@context.description: The [JSON-LD](https://json-ld.org/) Context URI for ISCC metadata.

@type.description: The type of digital content according to schema.org classes (TextDigitalDocument, ImageObject, AudioObject, VideoObject).

$schema.title: $Schema
$schema.description: The [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org/) URI for ISCC metadata.

iscc.title: Iscc
iscc.description: An **ISCC-CODE** in canonical representation. This is the minimal required field for a valid ISCC Metadata object.

name.title: Name
name.description: The title or name of the intangible creation manifested by the identified *digital content* (used as input for **ISCC Meta-Code** generation).

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the *digital content* identified by the **ISCC** (used as input for Meta-Code generation). Any user presentable text string (including Markdown text) indicative of the identity  of the referent may be used.
description.example: a 1984 fantasy film co-written and directed by *Wolfgang Petersen*

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Descriptive, industry-sector or use-case specific metadata. Can be any object that is JSON/JCS serializable. If `metadata` is provided it is used as an input for Meta-Code generation and as the sole input for the cryptographic `metahash` calculation. If `metadata` is set to a string it is assumed that it is base64 encoded binary file metadata.

image.title: Image
image.description: URI for a user-presentable image that serves as a preview of the *digital content*. The URI may be a Data-URL [RFC2397](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc2397). If **ISCC** metadata is used as NFT metadata according to [ERC-721](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/standards/tokens/erc-721/) or [ERC-1155](https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/standards/tokens/erc-1155/) the URI should reference the actual digital content represented by the NFT.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Other identifier(s) referencing the work, product or other abstraction of which the referenced **digital content** is a full or partial manifestation.

content.title: Content
content.description: URI of the *digital content* that was used to create this ISCC.

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.

acquire.title: Acquire
acquire.description: This field must contain a valid URL referring to a page showing information about how one can acquire a license for the item. This may be a page of a web shop or NFT marketplace ready for providing a license.

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: A line of text that the supplier expects users of the image (such as Google Images) to display to users alongside the image.

rights.title: Rights
rights.description: Contains any necessary copyright notice and should identify the current owner of the copyright of this work with associated intellectual property rights.

keywords.title: Keywords
keywords.description: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

license.title: License
license.description: URI of license for the identified *digital content*.

redirect.title: Redirect
redirect.description: URL to which a resolver should redirect an ISCC-ID that has been minted from a declartion that includes the IPFS-hash of this metadata instance.

previous.title: Previous
previous.description: ISCC of the preceding version of this item.

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

created.title: Created
created.description: Datetime the ISCC was created for the item.

filename.title: Filename
filename.description: Filename of the referenced **digital content** (automatically used as fallback if the `name` field was not specified for ISCC processing)

filesize.title: Filesize
filesize.description: File size of media asset in number of bytes.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Duration of audio-visual media in secondes.

fps.title: Fps
fps.description: Frames per second of video assets.

width.title: Width
width.description: Width of visual media in number of pixels.

height.title: Height
height.description: Height of visual media in number of pixels.

characters.title: Characters
characters.description: Number of text characters (code points after Unicode normalization)

pages.title: Pages
pages.description: Number of pages (for paged documents only)

parts.title: Parts
parts.description: Indicates items that are part of this item via Content-Codes (inverse-property belongs).

part_of.title: Part Of
part_of.description: Indicates that this item is part of other items via their Content-Code.

generator.title: Generator
generator.description: Name and version of the software that generated the ISCC

external_url.title: External Url
external_url.description: This is the URL that will appear below the asset's image on some NFT Marketplaces and will allow users to leave the site and view the item on your site.

animation_url.title: Animation Url
animation_url.description: A URL to a multi-media attachment for the item.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Descriptive, industry-sector or use-case specific metadata. Can be any object that is JSON/JCS serializable. If properties are provided they are the sole input for the cryptographic `metahash` calculation. Also compatible with [ERC-1155](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1155). If properties is set to a string it is assumed that it is base64 encoded binary file metadata.

tophash.title: Tophash
tophash.description: A [Multihash](https://multiformats.io/multihash/) of the concatenation (binding) of metahash and datahash (default blake3).

metahash.title: Metahash
metahash.description: A [Multihash](https://multiformats.io/multihash/) of the supplied metadata (default blake3). The hash is created from `name` and `description` fields or `properties` if supplied. For deterministic results [JSC RFC5452](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8785) canonicalization is applied to `properties` before hashing if it is a JSON object.

Type.title: Type
Type.description: The type of digital content according to schema.org classes (TextDigitalDocument, ImageObject, AudioObject, VideoObject).
